TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed ReferralChasingOption extends System.Enum

Docs.summary: The enumeration specifies if and how referral chasing is pursued.

remarks.format:
## Remarks When a server determines that other servers hold relevant information the server might refer the client to another server to obtain the result. Referral chasing is the process by which a client contacts the referenced server to continue the directory search.
Use the constants of this enumeration to set up search preferences for referral chasing. The action involves assigning the appropriate fields of <xref:System.DirectoryServices.DirectorySearcher> to elements of the <xref:System.DirectoryServices.ReferralChasingOption> enumeration.
The ADSI LDAP provider supports external referrals for paged searches, but does not support subordinate referrals during paging.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.DirectoryServices.ReferralChasingOption All = int32(96)

Docs.summary: Chase referrals of either the subordinate or external type.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.DirectoryServices.ReferralChasingOption External = int32(64)

Docs.summary: Chase external referrals. If no referral chasing option is specified for a directory search, the type of referral chasing performed is .

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.DirectoryServices.ReferralChasingOption None = int32(0)

Docs.summary: Never chase the referred-to server. Setting this option prevents a client from contacting other servers in a referral process.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.DirectoryServices.ReferralChasingOption Subordinate = int32(32)

Docs.summary: Chase only subordinate referrals that are a subordinate naming context in a directory tree. The ADSI LDAP provider always turns off this flag for paged searches.
